instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2289: What is A2289? A2289 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3456, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01987..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).
definitions.PP1V1_SLPS2R: What is PP1V1_SLPS2R? The PP1V1_SLPS2R power rail in the MacBook schematic provides a 1.1-volt supply in a specific low-power state indicated by the "_SLPS2R" suffix and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP1V2_AWAKE: What is PP1V2_AWAKE? The PP1V2_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is a power rail that provides 1.2 volts and is associated with the machine's awake state and is used for powering the T2 chip..
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not starting
threads.message:
Hi,
Have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> who doesn't start.

From USB C, switch from 5V to 20V and stay at 20V, but with 0.1A.

[SIZE=5][I]Voltage I have :[/I][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][I]GENERAL[/I]
[LIST]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>[/B] 12V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>[/B] 3.3V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>[/B] 5V
[/LIST]
[*][I]AWAKE[/I]
[LIST]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_AWAKE</SIGNAL> [/B]3.3V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP1V2_AWAKE</SIGNAL> [/B]1.2V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PPVDDCPU_AWAKE</SIGNAL> [/B]0.75V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL> [/B]1.8V
[*][B]PPVDDCPUSRAM_AWAKE [/B]0.8V
[/LIST]
[*][I]SLP2R[/I]
[LIST]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP1V1_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> [/B]1.1V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> [/B]1.8V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP0V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL> [/B]0.8V
[/LIST]
[*][I]SSD[/I]
[LIST]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PPVCCQ_ANI_SSD0</SIGNAL> [/B]1.8V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> [/B]0.9V
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> [/B]2.5V
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5]Voltage I don't have[/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>[/B]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PPVPCORE_S5</SIGNAL>[/B]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP1V_PRIM</SIGNAL>[/B]
[*][B]<SIGNAL>PP0V95_S0_CPUVCCIO</SIGNAL> and all <SIGNAL>VCC_CORE</SIGNAL>[/B]
[/LIST]

Do you have any idea of what to check ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not starting
threads.message:
Any history available?

Do you get SSD voltages?
Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not starting
threads.message:
No history for this mac
I will edit, yes I  have all SSD
Yes recognized in DFU. I did the short of SE032, tried to restore, it goes to step 4, approx 33% and stay. After 30 min I canceled the procedure

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2289</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not starting
threads.message:
Try again DFU disconnecting internal LCD.
Also try with battery connected (holding some charge).
